rh_pr_contributions.name: PR/Commit Contributions
rh_pr_contributions.description: Pull requests, merge requests, git commits, or other code contributions authored or co-authored by Red Hat employees

5.label: Dominant contributor
5.criteria: Red Hat employees author >= 30% of merged PRs in the evaluation period

4.label: Major contributor
4.criteria: Red Hat employees author 20-29% of merged PRs

3.label: Significant contributor
3.criteria: Red Hat employees author 10-19% of merged PRs

2.label: Minor contributor
2.criteria: Red Hat employees author 1-9% of merged PRs

1.label: No contributions
1.criteria: No Red Hat employee PRs found in the evaluation period

rh_release_management.name: Release Management
rh_release_management.description: Release managers responsible for the project's release activities and responsibilities that are Red Hat employees

5.label: Primary with succession
5.criteria: Red Hat employee is primary release manager with at least one additional RH backup/successor

4.label: Primary release manager
4.criteria: Red Hat employee is the primary or sole release manager

3.label: One of multiple
3.criteria: Red Hat employee is one of multiple release managers

2.label: Release-adjacent
2.criteria: Red Hat employee participates in release activities but is not a named release manager

1.label: None
1.criteria: No Red Hat employee involvement in release management identified

rh_maintainership.name: Maintainer/Reviewer/Approver Roles
rh_maintainership.description: Red Hat employees with maintainer, reviewer, approver, or other contributor authorization authority

5.label: Broad maintainership
5.criteria: >= 3 Red Hat maintainers/approvers across multiple subsystems or components

4.label: Multiple maintainers
4.criteria: 2 Red Hat maintainers/approvers in the project

3.label: Single maintainer
3.criteria: 1 Red Hat maintainer/approver in the project

2.label: Reviewer only
2.criteria: Red Hat employees serve as reviewers but not maintainers/approvers

1.label: None
1.criteria: No Red Hat employees in any maintainer, reviewer, or approver roles

rh_roadmap_influence.name: Roadmap Influence
rh_roadmap_influence.description: Roadmap features led by or influenced by Red Hat employees

5.label: Strategic leadership
5.criteria: Red Hat employees lead multiple roadmap features and participate in strategic planning

4.label: Feature leadership
4.criteria: Red Hat employees lead at least 1 major roadmap feature or enhancement

3.label: Active contribution
3.criteria: Red Hat employees actively contribute to roadmap features or proposals

2.label: Participation
2.criteria: Red Hat employees participate in roadmap discussions but do not lead features

1.label: None
1.criteria: No Red Hat employee involvement in roadmap or feature planning identified

rh_leadership_roles.name: Leadership Roles
rh_leadership_roles.description: Technical Advisory Council, Advisory Board, Steering Committee, or other governance leadership positions held by Red Hat employees

5.label: Multiple leadership positions
5.criteria: >= 2 governance positions including at least one chair/lead role held by Red Hat employees

4.label: Steering/TAC membership
4.criteria: Red Hat employee holds a seat on the steering committee or Technical Advisory Council

3.label: Working group leadership
3.criteria: Red Hat employee leads a working group, SIG, or similar sub-governance body

2.label: Working group member
2.criteria: Red Hat employee is a member (not lead) of a working group or SIG

1.label: None
1.criteria: No Red Hat employee involvement in project governance or leadership identified

confidence_levels.high: Data from authoritative source (LDAP, GitHub API, governance files in repo). GitHub username resolved via LDAP rhatSocialURL.
confidence_levels.medium: Data from GitHub API but employee resolved via git log email match. Or data from semi-structured project docs.
confidence_levels.low: Data from web search or employee resolved via gh search users name match. May require manual verification.
confidence_levels.not_found: Could not find data for this metric. The absence of data does not necessarily mean absence of contribution.

coverage_thresholds.warning_message: GitHub username resolution coverage is below 70%. Contribution metrics may undercount Red Hat involvement.
